I would recommend watching "Man on Wire" (2008) directed by Philippe Petit, which is based on his real-life act of tightrope walking between two skyscrapers in New York City while the World Trade Center was under construction. The movie tells the story of how he came up with the idea of doing this walk and what happened after he did it.

Based on the user's preference cues, I recommend two movies: "Zero DarkThirty" and "What Women Want".

"Zero DarkThirty" is a gripping movie based on the true story of the hunt for Osama bin Laden after the September 2001 attacks.

"What Women Want" is another highly recommended movie. It tells the inspiring story of August Pullman, a boy with facial differences who enters the fifth grade, attending a mainstream elementary school for the first time.

Both movies are highly rated by audiences and critics alike. They offer compelling stories, well-developed characters, and excellent direction and filmmaking.
